snippet: For people who can afford at least a contribution of $5,000, donor-advised funds have emerged as a practical alternative, offering their own tax and privacy advantages.
abstract: Donor-advised-funds, or DAF's, have emerged as viable alternative to contributing to a qualified organization for people with substantial wealth, as they offer their own tax, privacy and administrative advantages; they are funds over which donors retain considerable influence, though they are set up to be administered and legally controlled by a third party.
lead_paragraph: For people who can afford at least a contribution of $5,000, donor-advised funds have emerged as a practical alternative, offering their own tax and privacy advantages.

headline.main: Specialty Funds Appeal to the Hands-On Donor
headline.print_headline: Specialty Funds Appeal to the Hands-On Donor
